newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine to sell 26 pct shares in paper maker.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine to sell 26 pct shares in paper maker.

text.p: Ukraine's State Property Fund plans to offer for sale 26 percent of shares in the country's largest newsprint maker to a strategic investor, the company director said on Monday.
"Fifty-one percent of shares in the Zhydachivsky TsBK paper manufacturer will remain in state hands and 11 percent will be controlled by the workers' collective," Mikhailo Tytykalo said.

Strategic investor shares were increased to 26 percent from 20 percent allocated in a previous plan, after workers purchased only 11 percent shares instead of their allotted 19 percent, he told Reuters.
The remaining shares will be privatised through certificates held by citizens, he added.
The Zhydachivsky company is one of 208 government-designated companies to be privatised through strategic investment.

Zhydachivsky's authorised capital is valued at 22.8 million hryvnias ($13 million). During the first eight months of this year the company manufactured 11,800 tonnes of newsprint and 13,000 tonnes of office stationery.
Paper was exported to Bulgaria, Hungary, Moldova and Turkmenistan. --Yuri Kulikov, Kiev Bureau +380 44 229 2264
